4.name: World Braille Day
4.remarks: World Braille Day celebrates awareness of the importance of braille as a means of communication in the full realization of the human rights for blind and visually impaired people

24.name: International Day of Education
24.remarks: International Day of Education is a celebration of the role of education for peace and development.

5.name: Kashmir Solidarity Day
5.remarks: Protest against Indian administration in Jammu and Kashmir.

11.name: International Day of Women and Girls in Science
11.remarks: The day recognizes the critical role women and girls play in science and technology.

13.name: World Radio Day
13.remarks: World Radio Day celebrates radio as the mass media reaching the widest audience in the world.

20.name: World Day of Social Justice
20.remarks: World Day of Social Justice is an international day recognizing the need to promote social justice, which includes efforts to tackle issues such as poverty, exclusion, gender equality, unemployment, human rights, and social protections.

21.name: International Mother Language Day
21.remarks: International Monthe Language Day is celebrated to promote awareness of linguistic and cultural diversity and to promote multilingualism.

3.name: World Wildlife Day
3.remarks: World Wildlife Day is the international day of the adoption of the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora on the planet raise awarensess and benefits fauna and flora.

21.name: World Poetry Day
21.remarks: World Poetry Day is celebrated with the aim of supporting linguistic diversity through poetic expression and increasing the opportunity for endangered languages to be heard.

21.name: International Day of Forests
21.remarks: International Day of Forests is celebrate to raise awareness of the importance of all types of forests, and trees outside forests, for the benefit of current and future generations.

22.name: World Water Day
22.remarks: World Water Day  is used to advocate for the sustainable management of freshwater resources.

23.name: Pakistan Day
23.remarks: Commemorates the Lahore Resolution, which formally demanded an independent Muslim-majority state to be created out of the British Indian Empire.

6.name: International Day of Sport for Development and Peace
6.remarks: The International Day of Sport for Development and Peace is an annual celebration of the power of sport to drive social change, community development and to foster peace and understanding.

7.name: World Health Day
7.remarks: The World Health Day is a global health awareness day celebrated every year, under the sponsorship of the World Health Organization, as well as other related organizations.

21.name: Iqbal's Death Anniversary
21.remarks: Death Anniversary of Allama Muhammad Iqbal, National Poet and 'Spirtual Father Of Pakistan'

22.name: International Mother Earth Day
22.remarks: International Mother Earth Day recognizes that "the Earth and its ecosystems are our home" and that "it is necessary to promote harmony with nature and the Earth."

23.name: World Book and Copyright Day
23.remarks: World Book Day, also known as World Book and Copyright Day, or International Day of the Book, is an annual event organized by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization to promote reading, publishing, and copyright.

30.name: International Jazz Day
30.remarks: International Jazz Day is an International Day declared by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization in 2011 "to highlight jazz and its diplomatic role of uniting people in all corners of the globe."

3.name: World Press Freedom Day
3.remarks: World Press Freedom Day is observed to raise awareness of the importance of freedom of the press and remind governments of their duty to respect and uphold the right to freedom of expression

20.name: World Bee Day
20.remarks: The purpose of the international World Bee Day is to acknowledge the role of bees and other pollinators for the ecosystem.

21.name: International Tea Day
21.remarks: The International Tea Day aims to raise awareness of the long history and the deep cultural and economic significance of tea around the world.

28.name: Youm-e-Takbir
28.remarks: Celebrated as a national day in Pakistan on May 28 in commemoration of Chagai-I and Chagai-II Nuclear Tests.

1.name: Global Day of Parents
1.remarks: Global Day of Parents provides an opportunity to appreciate all parents in all parts of the world for their selfless commitment to children and their lifelong sacrifice towards nurturing this relationship.

5.name: World Environment Day
5.remarks: World Environment Day is celebrated on 5 June every year, and is the United Nations' principal vehicle for encouraging awareness and action for the protection of the environment.

21.name: International Day of the Celebration of the Solstice
21.remarks: International Day of the Celebration of the Solstice brings awareness to the importance that solstices and equinoxes have for many religions.

26.name: International Day against Drug Abuse and Illicit Trafficking
26.remarks: International Day against Drug Abuse and Illicit Trafficking

27.name: Micro-, Small and Medium-sized Enterprises Day
27.remarks: Micro-, Small and Medium-sized Enterprises Day

30.name: World Day against Trafficking in Persons
30.remarks: World Day against Trafficking in Persons

9.name: International Day of the World's Indigenous Peoples
9.remarks: International Day of the World's Indigenous Peoples

14.name: Independence Day
14.remarks: Marking Pakistani independence from the United Kingdom, formation of Pakistan in 1947.

6.name: Defence Day
6.remarks: Army Day/Defence Day or armed forces day of Pakistan (Youm-e-Fauj/Youm-e-Difa). On this day the 1965 Indo-Pak war began.

7.name: International Day of Clean Air for Blue Skies
7.remarks: International Day of Clean Air for Blue Skies

7.name: Air Force Day
7.remarks: Air Force Day (Youm-e-Fizaia) Depend on Federal Government on this day M.M. Alam shot 5 planes in a minute in the 1965 Indo-Pak War to set a world record.

9.name: International Day to Protect Education from Attack
9.remarks: International Day to Protect Education from Attack

16.name: International Day for the Preservation of the Ozone Layer
16.remarks: International Day for the Preservation of the Ozone Layer

26.name: International Day for the Total Elimination of Nuclear Weapons
26.remarks: International Day for the Total Elimination of Nuclear Weapons

28.name: International Day for Universal Access to Information
28.remarks: International Day for Universal Access to Information

11.name: International Day of the Girl Child
11.remarks: International Day of the Girl Child

13.name: International Day for Disaster Risk Reduction
13.remarks: International Day for Disaster Risk Reduction

16.name: Liaqat Ali Khan's Death Anniversary
16.remarks: Death anniversary of Nawabzada Liaquat Ali Khan, widely known as Quaid-e-Millat (Leader of the Nation) and Shaheed-e-Millat and Pakistan's First Prime Minister

17.name: International Day for the Eradication of Poverty
17.remarks: International Day for the Eradication of Poverty

10.name: World Science Day for Peace and Development
10.remarks: World Science Day for Peace and Development

15.name: World Day of Remembrance for Road Traffic Victims
15.remarks: World Day of Remembrance for Road Traffic Victims

25.name: International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women
25.remarks: International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women

29.name: International Day of Solidarity with the Palestinian People
29.remarks: International Day of Solidarity with the Palestinian People

30.name: Day of Remembrance for all Victims of Chemical Warfare
30.remarks: Day of Remembrance for all Victims of Chemical Warfare

2.name: International Day for the Abolition of Slavery
2.remarks: International Day for the Abolition of Slavery

3.name: International Day of Persons with Disabilities
3.remarks: International Day of Persons with Disabilities

5.name: International Volunteer Day for Economic and Social Development
5.remarks: International Volunteer Day for Economic and Social Development

25.name: Quaid-e-Azam Day
25.remarks: Birthday of Muhammad Ali Jinnah, founder of Pakistan.
